FuncDef:
The checkzero command enables the check on the Must-Be-Zero (MBZ) field in RIP version 1 (RIPv1) packets.
The undo checkzero command cancels the check to save the CPU resource.
By default, the check on the MBZ field of RIP-1 packets is enabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable the check on the MBZ field, run the checkzero command. The command is valid only for RIP-1 packets because there are no MBZ field in RIP-2 packets.
Configuration Impact
By default, devices discard all RIP-1 packets with a non-zero MBZ field.
To allow a Huawei device to communicate with a non-Huawei device that can send RIP-1 packets with a non-zero MBZ field, run the undo checkzero command on the Huawei device. However, exercise caution when running the command because it may decrease security.
